thread.title: Fed Minutes Could Offer Hints on Timing of Rate Rises, Balance Sheet Moves - WSJ
thread.title_full: Fed Minutes Could Offer Hints on Timing of Rate Rises, Balance Sheet Moves - WSJ

author: David Harrison
title: Fed Minutes Could Offer Hints on Timing of Rate Rises, Balance Sheet Moves - WSJ
text:
Fed Minutes Could Offer Hints on Timing of Rate Rises, Balance Sheet Moves Minutes also could show how central bankers view recent data showing rising inflation By @d_harrison Updated Feb. 22, 2017 5:59 a.m. ET 
The Federal Reserve left interest rates unchanged at its Jan. 31-Feb. 1 meeting, issuing a statement that skirted any signals about the timing of future rate increases, the central bank’s plans for its portfolio of assets or its take on the Trump administration’s fiscal policies. Minutes from that meeting, set for release at 2 p.m. EST Wednesday, could offer details of any internal discussions of these issues and others. Here’s what to watch: A March Signal To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Most Popular Videos
